actor_awards.notes: The first Hispanic actor to win an Academy Award (Best Actor for 'Cyrano de Bergerac'). He was also a distinguished stage actor and director, winning Tony Awards for both acting and directing. He received the National Medal of Arts in 1985.

filmography.title: Cyrano de Bergerac
filmography.role_description: A poetic, swordsman soldier with an enormous nose who aids another man in wooing the woman he secretly loves.
filmography.plot: A 17th-century French cavalier with a large nose writes letters for a handsome soldier to help him woo the woman they both love.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor in a Motion Picture - Drama

filmography.title: Moulin Rouge
filmography.role: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec / The Comte de Toulouse-Lautrec
filmography.role_description: Ferrer plays the dual roles of the diminished, alcoholic painter and his father.
filmography.plot: The story of the crippled artist Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec, who finds solace in his art and the nightlife of 19th-century Paris.

filmography.title: Joan of Arc
filmography.role_description: The weak-willed and indecisive heir to the French throne whom Joan convinces to claim his crown. Ferrer's film debut.
filmography.plot: The 15th-century French peasant girl Joan of Arc leads the French army against the English and is later tried for heresy.

filmography.title: The Caine Mutiny
filmography.role_description: A reluctant defense attorney who defends the mutineers but delivers a scathing rebuke of their actions.
filmography.plot: When a U.S. Naval captain shows signs of mental instability that jeopardizes the ship, the first officer relieves him of command and faces court-martial for mutiny.

filmography.title: Lawrence of Arabia
filmography.role_description: A sadistic Turkish governor who captures and tortures T.E. Lawrence in Deraa.
filmography.plot: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War II.

filmography.title: Ship of Fools
filmography.role_description: An arrogant, anti-Semitic German publisher traveling on an ocean liner in 1933.
filmography.plot: A diverse group of passengers on an ocean liner bound for Germany in 1933 grapple with their personal problems and the rising tide of fascism.

filmography.title: The Greatest Story Ever Told
filmography.role_description: The ruler of Galilee who orders the execution of John the Baptist.
filmography.plot: An all-star cast epic retelling of the life of Jesus Christ, from the Nativity to the Resurrection.

filmography.title: Crisis
filmography.role_description: A Latin American dictator who requires brain surgery from an American doctor he is holding hostage.
filmography.plot: An American neurosurgeon is forced to perform a delicate operation on a detested dictator while revolutionaries kidnap the doctor's wife.

filmography.title: Whirlpool
filmography.role_description: A sinister hypnotist who manipulates a kleptomaniac woman to frame her for murder.
filmography.plot: A woman suffering from kleptomania falls under the spell of a hypnotist who uses her to cover up a murder.

filmography.title: The Shrike
filmography.role_description: A theater director driven to a nervous breakdown by his manipulative and domineering wife.
filmography.plot: A theater director is driven to a nervous breakdown by his domineering wife and must fight for his sanity in a psychiatric ward.

filmography.title: I Accuse!
filmography.role_description: The French Jewish officer wrongly convicted of treason in the famous Dreyfus Affair. Ferrer also directed this film.
filmography.plot: The true story of Captain Alfred Dreyfus, who was wrongly accused of treason in 19th-century France due to anti-Semitism.

filmography.title: Miss Sadie Thompson
filmography.role_description: A zealous and hypocritical missionary who tries to reform a woman with a questionable past.
filmography.plot: A marine stationed on a Pacific island falls for a woman with a checkered past, drawing the ire of a self-righteous missionary.

filmography.title: Deep in My Heart
filmography.role_description: The Hungarian-American composer known for his operettas in this musical biopic.
filmography.plot: A musical biography of composer Sigmund Romberg, featuring many of his most famous songs performed by MGM stars.

filmography.title: The Cockleshell Heroes
filmography.role_description: The unconventional leader of a Royal Marines unit undertaking a dangerous kayak mission. Ferrer also directed.
filmography.plot: During World War II, a Royal Marine major trains volunteers for a daring canoe raid on German ships in Bordeaux harbor.

filmography.title: The Great Man
filmography.role_description: A cynical reporter investigating the life of a beloved radio host, discovering the dark truth. Ferrer also directed and co-wrote.
filmography.plot: A reporter investigating the life of a recently deceased and beloved radio host discovers he was actually a despicable person.

filmography.title: The High Cost of Loving
filmography.role_description: A happily married man whose life is disrupted when he fears he is about to lose his job. Ferrer also directed.
filmography.plot: A long-time employee fears he is about to be fired when he is left off a guest list, not knowing it's a mistake.

filmography.title: Nine Hours to Rama
filmography.role_description: A dedicated Indian police officer trying to prevent the assassination of Mahatma Gandhi.
filmography.plot: The fictionalized account of the nine hours leading up to the assassination of Mahatma Gandhi.

filmography.title: Voyage of the Damned
filmography.role_description: The corrupt Cuban Director of Immigration who refuses entry to Jewish refugees.
filmography.plot: Jewish refugees fleeing Nazi Germany on an ocean liner are refused entry by Cuba and the US, forcing them to return to Europe.

filmography.title: The Sentinel
filmography.role_description: A mysterious priest involved in the supernatural events surrounding a gateway to Hell.
filmography.plot: A fashion model moves into a house where a blind priest sits at the window, not knowing the building guards the gates of Hell.

filmography.title: Fedora
filmography.role_description: A disgraced plastic surgeon who helps a reclusive movie star maintain her youth.
filmography.plot: A down-on-his-luck Hollywood producer travels to Corfu to entice a reclusive, legendary actress out of retirement.

filmography.title: The Swarm
filmography.role_description: A scientist trying to combat a massive swarm of killer bees attacking Texas.
filmography.plot: A swarm of killer bees from South America attacks the United States, and a team of scientists and military personnel try to stop them.

filmography.title: The Fifth Musketeer
filmography.role_description: An aging musketeer who helps the son of Louis XIV take his rightful place.
filmography.plot: The Four Musketeers reunite to rescue the King's twin brother from the Bastille.

filmography.title: A Midsummer Night's Sex Comedy
filmography.role_description: A pompous, older philosopher engaged to a much younger woman in this Woody Allen comedy.
filmography.plot: Three couples get together for a weekend in the country in the early 1900s, leading to romance and philosophical discussions.

filmography.title: To Be or Not to Be
filmography.role_description: A Nazi spy posing as a Polish resistance supporter.
filmography.plot: A troupe of actors in Nazi-occupied Warsaw uses their acting skills to fool the occupying troops and protect the resistance.

filmography.title: Dune
filmography.role_description: The ruler of the Known Universe who plots against the Atreides family.
filmography.plot: A Duke's son leads desert warriors against the galactic emperor and his father's evil nemesis to free their desert world from the emperor's rule.

filmography.title: The Evil That Men Do
filmography.role_description: A doctor and friend to the protagonist, helping him track down a torturer.
filmography.plot: A professional assassin comes out of retirement to track down a Guatemalan doctor who is a master torturer for various dictators.
